summary: The Stop Poisoning Florida Act (H.R. 3818) aims to protect Florida's water resources. The bill directs the Secretary of the Army, through the Chief of Engineers, to prohibit discharges of water from Lake Okeechobee through specific lock and dam structures (S-308 and S-80) when the water's microcystin concentration exceeds the Environmental Protection Agency's recommended levels for recreational waters, as outlined in the referenced notice. The bill aims to protect public health and the environment.
